title: Homes Earned More for Owners Than Their Jobs Last Year
sub_head: Increase in value of typical U.S. home exceeded median worker income for first time, Zillow says
body:
In this booming housing market, many homeowners earned more last year from home appreciation than from their jobs.
Zillow Group Inc.â€™s home value index, which estimates the value of the typical U.S. home, rose 19.6% in 2021 to $321,634, an increase of $52,667 from 2020. That figure was slightly higher than what the median U.S. full-time worker earned, which was about $50,000 last year before taxes, according to Census Bureau data cited by Zillow.
